habilidades.descricao: Powers up “not very effective” moves.

Compound Eyes raises the ability-bearer's accuracy by 30%.In Generations 3-5, this ability's name was formatted as Compoundeyes.If a Pokémon with Compound Eyes is first in the party, Pokémon that can be holding items have that chance increase from 50% to 60% (for common items), 5% to 20% (for uncommon items) or 1% to 5% (for rare items).
The Pokémon may heal its own status problems.
Blaze increases the power of Fire-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).
During harsh sunlight, Solar Power raises the ability-bearer's Special Attack by 50%, but it also loses 1⁄8 of its maximum HP after each turn.
Blocks the added effects of attacks taken.No Pokémon have Shield Dust as a hidden ability.

Run Away allows the bearer to flee a battle with a wild Pokémon without fail, even if the opposing Pokémon has used a move like Mean Look or Bind, or has an ability such as Arena Trap.Pokémon with Run Away cannot switch out for another Pokémon, only flee. It does not allow the Pokémon to flee from Trainer battles.
Torrent increases the power of Water-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).
A Pokémon with Rain Dish will recover 1⁄16 of its maximum HP during rain, after each turn.

Drought creates harsh sunlight when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition.If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (Drought, Drizzle, Sand Stream or Snow Warning) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon.Prior to Generation 6, Drought lasts indefinitely upon activation.

Thick Fat reduces the damage taken from Fire-type and Ice-type moves by 50%.Interestingly, many Pokémon possessing this ability already take reduced damage from those types. A Dewgong or Walrein with Thick Fat would take 1⁄8 normal damage when hit by an Ice-type move.

Intimidate lower's the Attack of all opponents by one stage when the ability-bearer switches in (including the start of a battle).Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.If a Pokémon with Intimidate is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.

Swarm increases the power of Bug-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).If a Pokémon with Swarm is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.

Sniper increases the power of critical hits by 1.5×. This means a critical hit will deal 2.25× normal damage instead of 1.5×.In Generations 1-5 critical hits deal 2× normal damage, so Sniper inflicts 3× normal damage.

Insomnia prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep, both from moves by other Pokémon like Sing, and self-inflicted sleep like Rest.If a sleeping Pokémon aquires Insomnia (e.g. from Worry Seed, it will wake up on its next turn.

Keen Eye prevents the Pokémon from losing accuracy, for example from moves like Sand-Attack.If a Pokémon with Keen Eye is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.
When the HP of a Pokémon with Defeatist falls below 50%, its Attack and Special Attack stats are halved.No Pokémon have Defeatist as a hidden ability.
Big Pecks prevents the ability-bearer's Defense stat from being lowered, for example via Tail Whip.

When a Pokémon with Weak Armor is hit by a physical move, its Defense drops one stage, but its Speed increases by one stage.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Overcoat makes the Pokémon immune to residual damage from weather conditions (specifically Hail and Sandstorm).
Makes the foe nervous and unable to eat Berries.
Deals more damage to a Pokémon of same gender.

Levitate causes the Pokémon to be raised (like Flying-type Pokémon).Raised Pokémon are not affected by Ground-type moves, Spikes, Toxic Spikes nor Arena Trap. Full details in glossary.No Pokémon have Levitate as a hidden ability.

Infiltrator ignores the effects of Reflect, Light Screen and Safeguard. In other words, if the opponent has used Safeguard, Toxic would still badly poison them.

Power Construct is unique to Zygarde. When Zygarde 10% Forme or Zygarde 50% Forme falls below half HP, it changes into Zygarde Complete Forme.As Complete Forme has a higher base HP than the other two Formes, its HP is also restored by the same amount the maximum HP increased.No Pokémon have Power Construct as a hidden ability.

Aura Break cancels the effects of the abilities Fairy Aura and Dark Aura and instead reduces the power of Dark-type and Fairy-type moves by 25%, for all Pokémon on the field.Aura Break is not affected by the abilities Mold Breaker, Teravolt, or Turboblaze.Aura Break is the signature ability of Zygarde. Similarly, the abilities it reverses are also signature abilities of legendary Pokémon from Pokémon X&Y: Xerneas and Yveltal.No Pokémon have Aura Break as a hidden ability.

Sand Veil raises the ability-bearer's evasion by 20% in a sandstorm. It also gives immunity to sandstorm damage (if they are not already protected by being Ground/Rock/Steel type).If a Pokémon with Sand Veil is the leading party Pokémon while travelling in a sandstorm, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.
Creates a sandstorm when hit by an attack.No Pokémon have Sand Spit as a hidden ability.
The Pokémon may heal its own status problems.

Prism Armor reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%. It is not affected by the abilities Mold Breaker, Teravolt, or Turboblaze.For example, a Dark-type move used against a Psychic-type Pokémon with Prism Armor would deal 1.5× the usual damage instead of 2×. A double weakness would be reduced from 4× to 3×.No Pokémon have Prism Armor as a hidden ability.
Powers up moves that are super effective.No Pokémon have Neuroforce as a hidden ability.
Reflects status- changing moves.
May heal an ally's status conditions.

A Pokémon with Anticipation will shudder upon entering battle, if an opponent has a move that is super-effective against it, or a One-Hit-KO move (Fissure, Horn Drill, Guillotine or Sheer Cold). It only activates when the ability-bearer switches in, not when an opponent switches in.Anticipation does not activate if the opponent has a move that varies in type, such as Hidden Power, Judgment or Weather Ball, even if those moves would be super-effective.

Prankster increases the priority of status moves by +1.This means that a slower Pokémon with Prankster can use a status move before the opponent uses a regular move. Or if the ability-bearer is faster, it could use a status move before the opponent uses a priority move like Aqua Jet.The move Quick Guard does not block moves whose priority is increased by Prankster (but it does block moves that already have increased priority).
Steals an item when hit by another Pokémon.
The Pokémon can check a foe's held item.

If the opponent causes a burn, paralysis, or poisoning of a Pokémon with Synchronize, the opponent receives the status condition too. Self-inflicted status conditions (for example through the use of an item) are not passed on.In Generations 3-4, bad poison is only passed on as regular poison.If a Pokémon with Synchronize is the leading party Pokémon, there is a 50% chance of each wild Pokémon encountered having the same nature.No Pokémon have Synchronize as a hidden ability.

Psychic Surge creates a low-lying psychic field, like the move Psychic Terrain, when the Pokémon enters battle. It prevents high-priority moves being used and increases the power of Psychic type attacks.
Prevents the Pokémon from becoming confused.
Inner Focus prevents the Pokémon from flinching, for example when attacked by a move like Headbutt.
Boosts Defense in battle.No Pokémon have Dauntless Shield as a hidden ability.

The Pokémon ignores changes to opponents' evasiveness, its accuracy can't be lowered, and it can hit Ghost types with Normal- and Fighting-type moves.No Pokémon have Mind's Eye as a hidden ability.

Guts raises the ability-bearer's Attack by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If burnt, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Attack.All other effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), speed drop (paralysis) or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).
Prevents the Pokémon from becoming confused.
The Pokémon can't use any held items.

Run Away allows the bearer to flee a battle with a wild Pokémon without fail, even if the opposing Pokémon has used a move like Mean Look or Bind, or has an ability such as Arena Trap.Pokémon with Run Away cannot switch out for another Pokémon, only flee. It does not allow the Pokémon to flee from Trainer battles.

When another Pokémon on the field uses a single-use held item, a Pokémon with Pickup will obtain the used item (if they are not already holding anything) and it can be used again.Pokémon with Pickup will also obtain an item thrown at them with Fling (if they are not already holding anything).In Generations 3-4, Pickup has no effect in battle.When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with Pickup has a 10% chance of picking up an item (if they are not already holding an item).Items picked up range from Potions, Great Balls, Ultra Balls and Rare Candies up to Leftovers and some TMs. Better items have a lower chance of being found; furthermore, higher-level Pokémon will obtain better items.
Prevents the Pokémon from becoming confused.

Sheer Force increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects.Beneficial effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as:Non-beneficial effects, that Sheer Force will not activate for, include:If the user is holding a Life Orb and uses an attack that activates Sheer Force, it will not receive the 10% damage from Life Orb, but it gets boosts from both Life Orb and Sheer Force (total of 69% base power increase).Flamethrower normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. With Sheer Force, Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn.Note that if a move has an advantageous and disadvantageous side-effect, Sheer Force still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed. For example, Flare Blitz may cause a burn but also has recoil damage. A Pokémon with Sheer Force using the move would gain the power increase and still receive recoil damage, but it would never cause a burn.Here are the moves that increase in power under Sheer Force, listed alphabetically:

Hustle increases the ability-bearer's Attack by 50%, however, it also reduces the Accuracy of all Physical moves by 20%.If a Pokémon with Hustle is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

Cheek Pouch restores the bearer's HP when a Berry is consumed, on top of the berry's usual effects.So for example, it may cure a status condition and restore HP, or restore more HP than normal.No Pokémon have Cheek Pouch as a hidden ability.

Technician increases the power of moves - that are usually base power 60 or below - by 50%.Moves with variable base power are boosted only when it is 60 or below. For example, if Magnitude hits at level 6 it will be boosted from 50 to 75, but level 7 will stay at 70 base power.Moves like Sonic Boom that deal fixed HP damage are not affected by Technician.

Serene Grace doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items King's Rock and Razor Fang from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance).Serene Grace does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio.Shadow Ball normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 40% chance.Air Slash has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item King's Rock is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from King's Rock. This means Serene Grace with Air Slash and King's Rock gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch.In Generations 3-4 Serene Grace does not increase the flinch chance of King's Rock or Razor Fang.In Generations 3-5 Serene Grace does not affect the move Secret Power.

When a Pokémon with Rattled is hit by a Bug, Ghost or Dark type move, its Speed is raised one stage (up to the usual maximum of +6 stages).
Boosts Attack when hit by a Grass-type move.
Cud Chew causes the Pokémon to reuse an already consumed Berry at the end of the next turn.
Armor Tail prevents the opponent from using any moves that have priority, such as Quick Attack.No Pokémon have Armor Tail as a hidden ability.
A Pokémon with Water Absorb heals 1⁄4 of its maximum HP when hit by a Water-type attack.
Ignores any stat changes in the Pokémon.
Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.No Pokémon have Poison Point as a hidden ability.

Vital Spirit prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep. This means that it also prevents the use of the move Rest.If a Pokémon with Vital Spirit is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.
Inner Focus prevents the Pokémon from flinching, for example when attacked by a move like Headbutt.
Defiant raises the ability-bearer's Attack by two stages when hit by a stat-lowering move.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Sharpness increases the power of all slicing moves by 50%.The attacks classed as slicing moves are shown below with their normal and boosted power:*No Pokémon with Sharpness can learn these moves, however they can be called via Copycat, Metronome, Mimic, Mirror Move, or from a Pokémon that gained the ability (for example by Skill Swap).

Mold Breaker prevents a target's ability from affecting moves that the Mold Breaker Pokémon uses. It only affects abilities that change the power, accuracy or other effects of moves.For example, a Haxorus with Mold Breaker would be able to hit a Bronzong (having Levitate) using a Ground type move like Earthquake. Ground type moves would still not affect Flying types.However, if Dragon Claw KOs a Pokémon with Aftermath, a Mold Breaker Pokémon would still lose HP as Aftermath did not affect the Dragon Claw attack itself.
Prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.
Ignores any stat changes in the Pokémon.
Oblivious makes the Pokémon immune to gender-based moves and abilities, specifically Attract, Captivate and Cute Charm.
Sand Rush doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during a sandstorm.
Fluffy reduces damage from contact moves by 50%, but Fire-type moves do double damage. Fire-type moves that make contact do regular damage.

Storm Drain forces all single-target Water-type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. The ability is most useful in double/triple battles.When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.Storm Drain will activate for an Water-type Hidden Power, but not Water-type Judgment.The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the center of attention from the moves Follow Me or Rage Powder.In Generation 4, Storm Drain did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Water-type attacks. It also did not activate for Hidden Power.
Goes inside the mouth of an ally Dondozo if one is on the field.No Pokémon have Commander as a hidden ability.

Thick Fat reduces the damage taken from Fire-type and Ice-type moves by 50%.Interestingly, many Pokémon possessing this ability already take reduced damage from those types. A Dewgong or Walrein with Thick Fat would take 1⁄8 normal damage when hit by an Ice-type move.
Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in a hailstorm.

Sheer Force increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects.Beneficial effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as:Non-beneficial effects, that Sheer Force will not activate for, include:If the user is holding a Life Orb and uses an attack that activates Sheer Force, it will not receive the 10% damage from Life Orb, but it gets boosts from both Life Orb and Sheer Force (total of 69% base power increase).Flamethrower normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. With Sheer Force, Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn.Note that if a move has an advantageous and disadvantageous side-effect, Sheer Force still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed. For example, Flare Blitz may cause a burn but also has recoil damage. A Pokémon with Sheer Force using the move would gain the power increase and still receive recoil damage, but it would never cause a burn.Here are the moves that increase in power under Sheer Force, listed alphabetically:

When another Pokémon on the field uses a single-use held item, a Pokémon with Pickup will obtain the used item (if they are not already holding anything) and it can be used again.Pokémon with Pickup will also obtain an item thrown at them with Fling (if they are not already holding anything).In Generations 3-4, Pickup has no effect in battle.When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with Pickup has a 10% chance of picking up an item (if they are not already holding an item).Items picked up range from Potions, Great Balls, Ultra Balls and Rare Candies up to Leftovers and some TMs. Better items have a lower chance of being found; furthermore, higher-level Pokémon will obtain better items.
Fluffy reduces damage from contact moves by 50%, but Fire-type moves do double damage. Fire-type moves that make contact do regular damage.
Raises evasion if the Pokémon is confused.
Enables moves to hit Ghost-type Pokémon.
Copies ally's stat changes on entering battle.No Pokémon have the ability Costar as a regular ability.

Corrosion allows the bearer to poison any Pokémon, including Steel and Poison types.

Ground type moves would still not affect Flying types.However, if Dragon Claw KOs a Pokémon with Aftermath, a Mold Breaker Pokémon would still lose HP as Aftermath did not affect the Dragon Claw attack itself.
Blaze increases the power of Fire-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).
Ignores any stat changes in the Pokémon.
Dragon's Maw increases the power of Dragon-type moves used by this Pokémon by 50%.It is the signature ability of Regidrago.No Pokémon have Dragon's Maw as a hidden ability.
Boosts Attack after knocking out a Pokémon.No Pokémon have Chilling Neigh as a hidden ability.
Transistor increases the power of Electric-type moves used by this Pokémon by 50%.It is the signature ability of Regieleki.No Pokémon have Transistor as a hidden ability.
Contact moves can strike through Protect/Detect.No Pokémon have Unseen Fist as a hidden ability.

Leaf Guard prevents the bearer from succumbing to major status ailments (sleep, burns, poisoning, paralysis or freezing) during sunny weather.It does not prevent minor status ailments such as Confusion or Infatuation, nor does it prevent self-inflicted status conditions such as from using Rest.
Inner Focus prevents the Pokémon from flinching, for example when attacked by a move like Headbutt.
Boosts Attack in battle.No Pokémon have Intrepid Sword as a hidden ability.

Pressure makes any attack targeted at the ability-bearer - regardless of whether it hits - use 2 PP instead of 1.If a Pokémon with Pressure is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.
Ignores moves and abilities that draw in moves.No Pokémon have the ability Stalwart as a regular ability.

Sheer Force increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects.Beneficial effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as:Non-beneficial effects, that Sheer Force will not activate for, include:If the user is holding a Life Orb and uses an attack that activates Sheer Force, it will not receive the 10% damage from Life Orb, but it gets boosts from both Life Orb and Sheer Force (total of 69% base power increase).Flamethrower normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. With Sheer Force, Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn.Note that if a move has an advantageous and disadvantageous side-effect, Sheer Force still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed. For example, Flare Blitz may cause a burn but also has recoil damage. A Pokémon with Sheer Force using the move would gain the power increase and still receive recoil damage, but it would never cause a burn.Here are the moves that increase in power under Sheer Force, listed alphabetically:

Hunger Switch causes Morpeko to change its form each turn, alternating between Full Belly Mode and Hangry Mode. Morpeko's form also changes the type of its signature move, Aura Wheel.No Pokémon have Hunger Switch as a hidden ability.
Just being next to the Pokémon powers up moves.No Pokémon have Power Spot as a hidden ability.

Ice Face is the signature ability of Eiscue. It allows the Pokémon to take a physical attack without taking damage. After the attack, Eiscue changes to its No Ice Face form, however, it can be restored in hail.No Pokémon have Ice Face as a hidden ability.
Blocks the added effects of attacks taken.No Pokémon have Shield Dust as a hidden ability.
Halves damage from Special moves.No Pokémon have the ability Ice Scales as a regular ability.

Lightning Rod forces all single-target Electric-type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. This includes the status move Thunder Wave. The ability is most useful in double/triple battles.When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.Lightning Rod will activate for an Electric-type Hidden Power, but not Electric-type Judgment.The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the center of attention from the moves Follow Me or Rage Powder.In Generations 3-4, Lightning Rod did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Electric-type attacks. It also did not activate for Hidden Power.In Generations 3-5, this ability's name was formatted as Lightningrod.

Electric Surge creates a low-lying electric field, like the move Electric Terrain, when the Pokémon enters battle. It prevents grounded Pokémon from falling asleep, and increases the power of Electric type attacks.
Raises Speed each time the Pokémon flinches.
Enables moves to hit Ghost-type Pokémon.
Sweet Veil prevents this Pokémon and its allies from falling asleep, for example from moves like Hypnosis.

A Pokémon with Anticipation will shudder upon entering battle, if an opponent has a move that is super-effective against it, or a One-Hit-KO move (Fissure, Horn Drill, Guillotine or Sheer Cold). It only activates when the ability-bearer switches in, not when an opponent switches in.Anticipation does not activate if the opponent has a move that varies in type, such as Hidden Power, Judgment or Weather Ball, even if those moves would be super-effective.

Prankster increases the priority of status moves by +1.This means that a slower Pokémon with Prankster can use a status move before the opponent uses a regular move. Or if the ability-bearer is faster, it could use a status move before the opponent uses a priority move like Aqua Jet.The move Quick Guard does not block moves whose priority is increased by Prankster (but it does block moves that already have increased priority).

Lightning Rod forces all single-target Electric-type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. This includes the status move Thunder Wave. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.Lightning Rod will activate for an Electric-type Hidden Power, but not Electric-type Judgment.The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the center of attention from the moves Follow Me or Rage Powder.In Generations 3-4, Lightning Rod did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Electric-type attacks. It also did not activate for Hidden Power.In Generations 3-5, this ability's name was formatted as Lightningrod.

Comatose causes the Pokémon to behave as if it were asleep, though it doesn't officially have the Sleep status condition. Sheer Force increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects.Beneficial effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as:Non-beneficial effects, that Sheer Force will not activate for, include:If the user is holding a Life Orb and uses an attack that activates Sheer Force, it will not receive the 10% damage from Life Orb, but it gets boosts from both Life Orb and Sheer Force (total of 69% base power increase).Flamethrower normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. Sturdy allows the Pokémon to survive with 1 HP if attacked at full HP with an attack that would otherwise knock it out. It also prevents One-Hit-KO moves (Fissure, Horn Drill, Guillotine or Sheer Cold).If Sturdy activates before the final hit of a multi-hit move (such as Fury Swipes), the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the Pokémon to faint.Sturdy does not prevent self-inflicted KO moves such as Selfdestruct, Explosion and Final Gambit.
Prevents the Pokémon from becoming confused.

When another Pokémon on the field uses a single-use held item, a Pokémon with Pickup will obtain the used item (if they are not already holding anything) and it can be used again.Pokémon with Pickup will also obtain an item thrown at them with Fling (if they are not already holding anything).In Generations 3-4, Pickup has no effect in battle.When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with Pickup has a 10% chance of picking up an item (if they are not already holding an item).Items picked up range from Potions, Great Balls, Ultra Balls and Rare Candies up to Leftovers and some TMs. Better items have a lower chance of being found; furthermore, higher-level Pokémon will obtain better items.

Serene Grace doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items King's Rock and Razor Fang from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance).Serene Grace does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio.Shadow Ball normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 40% chance.Air Slash has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item King's Rock is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from King's Rock. This means Serene Grace with Air Slash and King's Rock gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch.In Generations 3-4 Serene Grace does not increase the flinch chance of King's Rock or Razor Fang.In Generations 3-5 Serene Grace does not affect the move Secret Power.

Download raises either the bearer's Attack or Special Attack by one stage when switching into battle, base on the opponent's defenses.It raises Attack if the opponent's Defense is lower than its Special Defense, or raises Special Attack if opponent's Special Defense is lower than or equal to its Defense.In double and triple battles, Download compares the sum of all opponents' Defense stats and the sum of all opponents' Special Defense stats and uses the lowest total.No Pokémon have Download as a hidden ability.
Justified raises the ability-bearer's Attack by one stage when hit by a damaging Dark-type move.The Attack rises for every hit of the move Beat Up.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Turboblaze prevents a target's ability from affecting moves that the Turboblaze Pokémon uses. It only affects abilities that change the power, accuracy or other effects of moves.For example, Reshiram would be able to hit Bronzong (having Levitate) using a Ground-type move like Earth Power. Ground type moves would still not affect Flying types.However, using Dragon Claw against a Pokémon with Aftermath would still receive HP loss as Aftermath did not affect the Dragon Claw attack itself.No Pokémon have Turboblaze as a hidden ability.

Teravolt prevents a target's ability from affecting moves that the Teravolt Pokémon uses. It only affects abilities that change the power, accuracy or other effects of moves.For example, Zekrom would be able to hit Bronzong (having Levitate) using a Ground-type move like Earth Power. Ground type moves would still not affect Flying types.However, using Dragon Claw against a Pokémon with Aftermath would still receive HP loss as Aftermath did not affect the Dragon Claw attack itself.No Pokémon have Teravolt as a hidden ability.

Sheer Force increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects.Beneficial effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as:Non-beneficial effects, that Sheer Force will not activate for, include:If the user is holding a Life Orb and uses an attack that activates Sheer Force, it will not receive the 10% damage from Life Orb, but it gets boosts from both Life Orb and Sheer Force (total of 69% base power increase).Flamethrower normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. With Sheer Force, Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn.Note that if a move has an advantageous and disadvantageous side-effect, Sheer Force still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed. For example, Flare Blitz may cause a burn but also has recoil damage. A Pokémon with Sheer Force using the move would gain the power increase and still receive recoil damage, but it would never cause a burn.Here are the moves that increase in power under Sheer Force, listed alphabetically:

Sand Force raises the power of Ground, Rock and Steel type moves by 30% during a sandstorm.It also grants immunity to the sandstorm damage, if not already immune (currently this only applies to Shellos since all other Pokémon with the ability are already immune).

Justified raises the ability-bearer's Attack by one stage when hit by a damaging Dark-type move.The Attack rises for every hit of the move Beat Up.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
A Pokémon with Volt Absorb heals 1⁄4 of its maximum HP when hit by an Electric-type attack, including Thunder Wave.In Generation 3, Volt Absorb does not activate for Thunder Wave.

A Pokémon with Regenerator restores 1⁄3 of its maximum HP when switching out.

Prankster increases the priority of status moves by +1.This means that a slower Pokémon with Prankster can use a status move before the opponent uses a regular move. Or if the ability-bearer is faster, it could use a status move before the opponent uses a priority move like Aqua Jet.The move Quick Guard does not block moves whose priority is increased by Prankster (but it does block moves that already have increased priority).
Defiant raises the ability-bearer's Attack by two stages when hit by a stat-lowering move.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Levitate causes the Pokémon to be raised (like Flying-type Pokémon).Raised Pokémon are not affected by Ground-type moves, Spikes, Toxic Spikes nor Arena Trap. Full details in glossary.No Pokémon have Levitate as a hidden ability.

Swarm increases the power of Bug-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).If a Pokémon with Swarm is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.

If a Pokémon with Flame Body is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance the attacker will become burned.If a Pokémon with Flame Body (or Magma Armor or Steam Engine) and a Pokémon Egg are both in the party Pokémon, the number of steps required to hatch the egg are halved.
Justified raises the ability-bearer's Attack by one stage when hit by a damaging Dark-type move.The Attack rises for every hit of the move Beat Up.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Justified raises the ability-bearer's Attack by one stage when hit by a damaging Dark-type move.The Attack rises for every hit of the move Beat Up.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Truant causes the ability-bearer to only attack every alternate turn. On the even turns, it will say the Pokémon is loafing around.If a Pokémon with Truant uses a move that requires recharging on the second turn (such as Hyper Beam), it will recharge on the same turn the Pokémon loafs around. Moves where the user prepares on the first turn and attacks on the second (such as Solarbeam or Fly) cannot be used.The moves Worry Seed, Entrainment and Simple Beam do not work on Pokémon with Truant.Truant can technically be Skill Swapped away, however neither Slakoth, Slaking or Durant learn it.

Hustle increases the ability-bearer's Attack by 50%, however, it also reduces the Accuracy of all Physical moves by 20%.If a Pokémon with Hustle is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

Sheer Force increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects.Beneficial effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as:Non-beneficial effects, that Sheer Force will not activate for, include:If the user is holding a Life Orb and uses an attack that activates Sheer Force, it will not receive the 10% damage from Life Orb, but it gets boosts from both Life Orb and Sheer Force (total of 69% base power increase).Flamethrower normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. With Sheer Force, Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn.Note that if a move has an advantageous and disadvantageous side-effect, Sheer Force still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed. For example, Flare Blitz may cause a burn but also has recoil damage. A Pokémon with Sheer Force using the move would gain the power increase and still receive recoil damage, but it would never cause a burn.Here are the moves that increase in power under Sheer Force, listed alphabetically:

A Pokémon with Gluttony will use a pinch berry when its HP drops to 50%, rather than the usual 25%.Pinch berries are: Figy, Wiki, Mago, Aguav, Iapapa, Liechi, Ganlon, Salac, Petaya, Apicot, Lansat, Starf, Micle and Custap. (Their descriptions state that they work in a pinch.)

When a Pokémon with Flash Fire is hit by a Fire-type move, it does not deal damage but instead raises the power of the bearer's Fire-type moves by 50%. Subsequent hits do not raise the power even more, but the effect remains while the ability-bearer is in battle.
Soundproof grants the Pokémon immunity to all sound-based moves, preventing all damage and effects.In Generation 5 only, Pokémon with Soundproof could be cured of status conditions by Heal Bell.
Boosts Attack when hit by a Grass-type move.

Mold Breaker prevents a target's ability from affecting moves that the Mold Breaker Pokémon uses. It only affects abilities that change the power, accuracy or other effects of moves.For example, a Haxorus with Mold Breaker would be able to hit a Bronzong (having Levitate) using a Ground type move like Earthquake. Serene Grace doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items King's Rock and Razor Fang from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance).Serene Grace does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio.Shadow Ball normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 40% chance.Air Slash has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item King's Rock is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from King's Rock. This means Serene Grace with Air Slash and King's Rock gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch.In Generations 3-4 Serene Grace does not increase the flinch chance of King's Rock or Razor Fang.In Generations 3-5 Serene Grace does not affect the move Secret Power.

Snow Warning creates a hailstorm when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition.If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (Snow Warning, Drizzle, Drought or Sand Stream) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon.Prior to Generation 6, Snow Warning lasts indefinitely upon activation.

When a Pokémon with Weak Armor is hit by a physical move, its Defense drops one stage, but its Speed increases by one stage.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Snow Cloak raises ability-bearer's evasion by 20% in a hail storm. It also gives immunity to damage by hail (if they are not already protected by being Ice type).If a Pokémon with Snow Cloak is the leading party Pokémon while travelling in a hail storm/blizzard, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.
A Pokémon with Ice Body will recover 1⁄16 of its maximum HP during hail, after each turn. It also grants immunity to the hailstorm damage, if not already immune.

Technician increases the power of moves - that are usually base power 60 or below - by 50%.Moves with variable base power are boosted only when it is 60 or below. For example, if Magnitude hits at level 6 it will be boosted from 50 to 75, but level 7 will stay at 70 base power.Moves like Sonic Boom that deal fixed HP damage are not affected by Technician.

Skill Link causes multi-strike moves to always hit their maximum number of times. The moves affected are listed below; note that moves such as Double Kick that always strike the same number of times are not affected.In Generation 4, Triple Kick is not affected by Skill Link.

If a Pokémon with Cute Charm is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance the attacker will become infatuated. It will not infatuate Pokémon of the same gender, genderless Pokémon, nor those with the ability Oblivious.Infatuated Pokémon have a 50% chance of being immobilized by love each turn and unable to attack.If a Pokémon with Cute Charm is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of encountering a Pokémon of the opposite gender is 2⁄3.
A Pokémon with Regenerator restores 1⁄3 of its maximum HP when switching out.
Overcoat makes the Pokémon immune to residual damage from weather conditions (specifically Hail and Sandstorm).

When a Pokémon with the Illusion ability switches into battle, it takes the form of the Pokémon in last place (6th) of the player's party. Illusion will not activate if the Pokémon in last place is the same species or is fainted.The effect is aesthetic only; Illusion does not change the Pokémon's type or moves, so for example a Fighting-type move against a Zoroark disguised as Gengar would still be super effective. Any direct attack (i.e. not entry hazards, weather conditions etc) will break the illusion.No Pokémon have Illusion as a hidden ability.
If an attacker faints a Pokémon with Aftermath using a contact move, the attacker will lose 1⁄4 of their maximum HP.

When a Pokémon with Weak Armor is hit by a physical move, its Defense drops one stage, but its Speed increases by one stage.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

A Pokémon with Stench has a 10% chance of causing the opponent to flinch when hit by a damaging move (provided the ability-bearer strikes first as usual).Stench does not stack with the items King's Rock or Razor Fang, so an ability-bearer holding either item will keep the flinch chance at 10%.In Generations 3-4, Stench has no effect in battle.If a Pokémon with Stench is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

Sturdy allows the Pokémon to survive with 1 HP if attacked at full HP with an attack that would otherwise knock it out. Prankster increases the priority of status moves by +1.This means that a slower Pokémon with Prankster can use a status move before the opponent uses a regular move. Or if the ability-bearer is faster, it could use a status move before the opponent uses a priority move like Aqua Jet.The move Quick Guard does not block moves whose priority is increased by Prankster (but it does block moves that already have increased priority).

When a Pokémon with Weak Armor is hit by a physical move, its Defense drops one stage, but its Speed increases by one stage.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Sturdy allows the Pokémon to survive with 1 HP if attacked at full HP with an attack that would otherwise knock it out. It also prevents One-Hit-KO moves (Fissure, Horn Drill, Guillotine or Sheer Cold).If Sturdy activates before the final hit of a multi-hit move (such as Fury Swipes), the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the Pokémon to faint.Sturdy does not prevent self-inflicted KO moves such as Selfdestruct, Explosion and Final Gambit.

Sand Force raises the power of Ground, Rock and Steel type moves by 30% during a sandstorm.It also grants immunity to the sandstorm damage, if not already immune (currently this only applies to Shellos since all other Pokémon with the ability are already immune).

Boosts Attack when hit by a Grass-type move.
Raises Speed if hit by an Electric-type move.

Lightning Rod forces all single-target Electric-type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. This includes the status move Thunder Wave. The ability is most useful in double/triple battles.When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.Lightning Rod will activate for an Electric-type Hidden Power, but not Electric-type Judgment.The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the center of attention from the moves Follow Me or Rage Powder.In Generations 3-4, Lightning Rod did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Electric-type attacks. It also did not activate for Hidden Power.In Generations 3-5, this ability's name was formatted as Lightningrod.

Sand Stream creates a sandstorm when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition.If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (Sand Stream, Drizzle, Drought or Snow Warning) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon.Prior to Generation 6, Sand Stream lasts indefinitely upon activation.No Pokémon have Sand Stream as a hidden ability.

Sand Force raises the power of Ground, Rock and Steel type moves by 30% during a sandstorm.It also grants immunity to the sandstorm damage, if not already immune (currently this only applies to Shellos since all other Pokémon with the ability are already immune).
Big Pecks prevents the ability-bearer's Defense stat from being lowered, for example via Tail Whip.
Super Luck raises the ability-bearer's critical-hit ratio by one stage (for most moves this increases from a 1⁄16 chance to 1⁄8).
Deals more damage to a Pokémon of same gender.
Ignores any stat changes in the Pokémon.

The Simple ability doubles the number of stages of all stat changes. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.For example, using Swords Dance would increase the Pokémon's attack by 4 stages instead of the usual 2. If Tail Whip was targeted at a Pokémon with Simple, its Defense would drop 2 stages instead of 1.The move Simple Beam can change a Pokémon's ability to Simple.In Generation 4, Simple doubles the effects of stat changes but does not increase the actual number of stages. Stat increases are capped at the same multiplier of ×4, as per the table below. However, the resulting effect is exactly the same as current games.
The Pokémon can't use any held items.

Pokémon with the Telepathy ability will not take damage from teammates in double and triple battles.This affects moves such as Surf and Earthquake, which normally hit all Pokémon on the field apart from the user.

If the opponent causes a burn, paralysis, or poisoning of a Pokémon with Synchronize, the opponent receives the status condition too. Self-inflicted status conditions (for example through the use of an item) are not passed on.In Generations 3-4, bad poison is only passed on as regular poison.If a Pokémon with Synchronize is the leading party Pokémon, there is a 50% chance of each wild Pokémon encountered having the same nature.No Pokémon have Synchronize as a hidden ability.
Determines what moves a foe has.No Pokémon have Forewarn as a hidden ability.
Blaze increases the power of Fire-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).

A Pokémon with Gluttony will use a pinch berry when its HP drops to 50%, rather than the usual 25%.Pinch berries are: Figy, Wiki, Mago, Aguav, Iapapa, Liechi, Ganlon, Salac, Petaya, Apicot, Lansat, Starf, Micle and Custap. (Their descriptions state that they work in a pinch.)

Prankster increases the priority of status moves by +1.This means that a slower Pokémon with Prankster can use a status move before the opponent uses a regular move. Or if the ability-bearer is faster, it could use a status move before the opponent uses a priority move like Aqua Jet.The move Quick Guard does not block moves whose priority is increased by Prankster (but it does block moves that already have increased priority).

Intimidate lower's the Attack of all opponents by one stage when the ability-bearer switches in (including the start of a battle).Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.If a Pokémon with Intimidate is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.

Vital Spirit prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep. This means that it also prevents the use of the move Rest.If a Pokémon with Vital Spirit is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

Run Away allows the bearer to flee a battle with a wild Pokémon without fail, even if the opposing Pokémon has used a move like Mean Look or Bind, or has an ability such as Arena Trap.Pokémon with Run Away cannot switch out for another Pokémon, only flee. It does not allow the Pokémon to flee from Trainer battles.

When another Pokémon on the field uses a single-use held item, a Pokémon with Pickup will obtain the used item (if they are not already holding anything) and it can be used again.Pokémon with Pickup will also obtain an item thrown at them with Fling (if they are not already holding anything).In Generations 3-4, Pickup has no effect in battle.When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with Pickup has a 10% chance of picking up an item (if they are not already holding an item).Items picked up range from Potions, Great Balls, Ultra Balls and Rare Candies up to Leftovers and some TMs. Better items have a lower chance of being found; furthermore, higher-level Pokémon will obtain better items.

Serene Grace doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items King's Rock and Razor Fang from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance).Serene Grace does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio.Shadow Ball normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 40% chance.Air Slash has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item King's Rock is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from King's Rock. This means Serene Grace with Air Slash and King's Rock gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch.In Generations 3-4 Serene Grace does not increase the flinch chance of King's Rock or Razor Fang.In Generations 3-5 Serene Grace does not affect the move Secret Power.

Solid Rock reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%.For example, a Water-type move used against a Rock-type Pokémon with Solid Rock would deal 1.5× the usual damage instead of 2×. A double weakness would be reduced from 4× to 3×.No Pokémon have Solid Rock as a hidden ability.

Reckless increases the power of recoil moves by 20%. By extension, this means the amount of recoil damage taken will increase as more damage is dealt (except for High Jump Kick and Jump Kick which are based on the user's HP).The attacks classed as punching moves are shown below with their normal and boosted power:* No Pokémon with Reckless can learn these moves.

Lightning Rod forces all single-target Electric-type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. This includes the status move Thunder Wave. The ability is most useful in double/triple battles.When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.Lightning Rod will activate for an Electric-type Hidden Power, but not Electric-type Judgment.The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the center of attention from the moves Follow Me or Rage Powder.In Generations 3-4, Lightning Rod did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Electric-type attacks. It also did not activate for Hidden Power.In Generations 3-5, this ability's name was formatted as Lightningrod.
Cloud Nine suppresses all effects brought on by weather, including move power increases, end-of-turn damage, accuracy changes, relevant abilities and so on.
Prevents the Pokémon from becoming confused.
Oblivious makes the Pokémon immune to gender-based moves and abilities, specifically Attract, Captivate and Cute Charm.
Prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.
Swift Swim doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during rain.

Storm Drain forces all single-target Water-type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. The ability is most useful in double/triple battles.When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.Storm Drain will activate for an Water-type Hidden Power, but not Water-type Judgment.The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the center of attention from the moves Follow Me or Rage Powder.In Generation 4, Storm Drain did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Water-type attacks. It also did not activate for Hidden Power.
Prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.
Swift Swim doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during rain.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.Storm Drain will activate for an Water-type Hidden Power, but not Water-type Judgment.The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the center of attention from the moves Follow Me or Rage Powder.In Generation 4, Storm Drain did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Water-type attacks. It also did not activate for Hidden Power.
A Pokémon with Water Absorb heals 1⁄4 of its maximum HP when hit by a Water-type attack.
Prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.
Swift Swim doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during rain.
Soundproof grants the Pokémon immunity to all sound-based moves, preventing all damage and effects.In Generation 5 only, Pokémon with Soundproof could be cured of status conditions by Heal Bell.

Snow Warning creates a hailstorm when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition.If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (Snow Warning, Drizzle, Drought or Sand Stream) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon.Prior to Generation 6, Snow Warning lasts indefinitely upon activation.
Soundproof grants the Pokémon immunity to all sound-based moves, preventing all damage and effects.In Generation 5 only, Pokémon with Soundproof could be cured of status conditions by Heal Bell.

In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon.Prior to Generation 6, Snow Warning lasts indefinitely upon activation.
May poison targets when a Pokémon makes contact.
Dry Skin causes several effects:

A Pokémon with Anticipation will shudder upon entering battle, if an opponent has a move that is super-effective against it, or a One-Hit-KO move (Fissure, Horn Drill, Guillotine or Sheer Cold). It only activates when the ability-bearer switches in, not when an opponent switches in.Anticipation does not activate if the opponent has a move that varies in type, such as Hidden Power, Judgment or Weather Ball, even if those moves would be super-effective.

Levitate causes the Pokémon to be raised (like Flying-type Pokémon).Raised Pokémon are not affected by Ground-type moves, Spikes, Toxic Spikes nor Arena Trap. Full details in glossary.No Pokémon have Levitate as a hidden ability.
Powers up “not very effective” moves.
Its Speed stat is gradually boosted.
The Pokémon can check a foe's held item.

Sniper increases the power of critical hits by 1.5×. This means a critical hit will deal 2.25× normal damage instead of 1.5×.In Generations 1-5 critical hits deal 2× normal damage, so Sniper inflicts 3× normal damage.

Keen Eye prevents the Pokémon from losing accuracy, for example from moves like Sand-Attack.If a Pokémon with Keen Eye is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.
Battle Armor prevents the Pokémon from receiving a critical hit.

The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition.If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (Sand Stream, Drizzle, Drought or Snow Warning) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. Sand Force raises the power of Ground, Rock and Steel type moves by 30% during a sandstorm.It also grants immunity to the sandstorm damage, if not already immune (currently this only applies to Shellos since all other Pokémon with the ability are already immune).

Thick Fat reduces the damage taken from Fire-type and Ice-type moves by 50%.Interestingly, many Pokémon possessing this ability already take reduced damage from those types. A Dewgong or Walrein with Thick Fat would take 1⁄8 normal damage when hit by an Ice-type move.

When another Pokémon on the field uses a single-use held item, a Pokémon with Pickup will obtain the used item (if they are not already holding anything) and it can be used again.Pokémon with Pickup will also obtain an item thrown at them with Fling (if they are not already holding anything).In Generations 3-4, Pickup has no effect in battle.When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with Pickup has a 10% chance of picking up an item (if they are not already holding an item).Items picked up range from Potions, Great Balls, Ultra Balls and Rare Candies up to Leftovers and some TMs. Better items have a lower chance of being found; furthermore, higher-level Pokémon will obtain better items.

A Pokémon with Gluttony will use a pinch berry when its HP drops to 50%, rather than the usual 25%.Pinch berries are: Figy, Wiki, Mago, Aguav, Iapapa, Liechi, Ganlon, Salac, Petaya, Apicot, Lansat, Starf, Micle and Custap. (Their descriptions state that they work in a pinch.)

Adaptability increases the effectiveness of STAB moves from the usual 1.5× to 2×.For example, a Water-type Pokémon using Surf (base power 90) would normally get an effective power of 135. With Adaptability it would be 180 instead.
Raises Speed each time the Pokémon flinches.
Justified raises the ability-bearer's Attack by one stage when hit by a damaging Dark-type move.The Attack rises for every hit of the move Beat Up.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Inner Focus prevents the Pokémon from flinching, for example when attacked by a move like Headbutt.

Sand Veil raises the ability-bearer's evasion by 20% in a sandstorm. It also gives immunity to sandstorm damage (if they are not already protected by being Ground/Rock/Steel type).If a Pokémon with Sand Veil is the leading party Pokémon while travelling in a sandstorm, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

When a Pokémon with Rough Skin is hit by a move that makes contact, the attacker receives damage equal to 1⁄8 of their maximum HP.Multi-hit moves (e.g. DoubleSlap) activate Rough Skin for each strike.In Generation 3, the damage from Rough Skin is 1⁄16 of the maximum HP.
Raises Speed each time the Pokémon flinches.

Prankster increases the priority of status moves by +1.This means that a slower Pokémon with Prankster can use a status move before the opponent uses a regular move. Or if the ability-bearer is faster, it could use a status move before the opponent uses a priority move like Aqua Jet.The move Quick Guard does not block moves whose priority is increased by Prankster (but it does block moves that already have increased priority).

Pressure makes any attack targeted at the ability-bearer - regardless of whether it hits - use 2 PP instead of 1.If a Pokémon with Pressure is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.
Infiltrator ignores the effects of Reflect, Light Screen and Safeguard. In other words, if the opponent has used Safeguard, Toxic would still badly poison them.
Big Pecks prevents the ability-bearer's Defense stat from being lowered, for example via Tail Whip.

Keen Eye prevents the Pokémon from losing accuracy, for example from moves like Sand-Attack.If a Pokémon with Keen Eye is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.

Serene Grace doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items King's Rock and Razor Fang from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance).Serene Grace does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio.Shadow Ball normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 40% chance.Air Slash has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item King's Rock is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from King's Rock. This means Serene Grace with Air Slash and King's Rock gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch.In Generations 3-4 Serene Grace does not increase the flinch chance of King's Rock or Razor Fang.In Generations 3-5 Serene Grace does not affect the move Secret Power.
All status problems heal when it switches out.
Reduces damage done to allies.

Technician increases the power of moves - that are usually base power 60 or below - by 50%.Moves with variable base power are boosted only when it is 60 or below. For example, if Magnitude hits at level 6 it will be boosted from 50 to 75, but level 7 will stay at 70 base power.Moves like Sonic Boom that deal fixed HP damage are not affected by Technician.

Sheer Force increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects.Beneficial effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as:Non-beneficial effects, that Sheer Force will not activate for, include:If the user is holding a Life Orb and uses an attack that activates Sheer Force, it will not receive the 10% damage from Life Orb, but it gets boosts from both Life Orb and Sheer Force (total of 69% base power increase).Flamethrower normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. With Sheer Force, Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn.Note that if a move has an advantageous and disadvantageous side-effect, Sheer Force still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed. For example, Flare Blitz may cause a burn but also has recoil damage. A Pokémon with Sheer Force using the move would gain the power increase and still receive recoil damage, but it would never cause a burn.Here are the moves that increase in power under Sheer Force, listed alphabetically:

Mold Breaker prevents a target's ability from affecting moves that the Mold Breaker Pokémon uses. Ground type moves would still not affect Flying types.However, if Dragon Claw KOs a Pokémon with Aftermath, a Mold Breaker Pokémon would still lose HP as Aftermath did not affect the Dragon Claw attack itself.

Deals more damage to a Pokémon of same gender.

Technician increases the power of moves - that are usually base power 60 or below - by 50%.Moves with variable base power are boosted only when it is 60 or below. For example, if Magnitude hits at level 6 it will be boosted from 50 to 75, but level 7 will stay at 70 base power.Moves like Sonic Boom that deal fixed HP damage are not affected by Technician.

The Simple ability doubles the number of stages of all stat changes. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.For example, using Swords Dance would increase the Pokémon's attack by 4 stages instead of the usual 2. Stat increases are capped at the same multiplier of ×4, as per the table below. However, the resulting effect is exactly the same as current games.

Serene Grace doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items King's Rock and Razor Fang from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance).Serene Grace does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio.Shadow Ball normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 40% chance.Air Slash has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item King's Rock is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from King's Rock. This means Serene Grace with Air Slash and King's Rock gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch.In Generations 3-4 Serene Grace does not increase the flinch chance of King's Rock or Razor Fang.In Generations 3-5 Serene Grace does not affect the move Secret Power.

Air Lock suppresses all effects brought on by weather, including move power increases, end-of-turn damage, accuracy changes, relevant abilities and so on.No Pokémon have Air Lock as a hidden ability.

Drizzle creates a rain shower when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition.If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (Drizzle, Drought, Sand Stream or Snow Warning) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon.Prior to Generation 6, Drizzle lasts indefinitely upon activation.

Drought creates harsh sunlight when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition.If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (Drought, Drizzle, Sand Stream or Snow Warning) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon.Prior to Generation 6, Drought lasts indefinitely upon activation.

Sheer Force increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects.Beneficial effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as:Non-beneficial effects, that Sheer Force will not activate for, include:If the user is holding a Life Orb and uses an attack that activates Sheer Force, it will not receive the 10% damage from Life Orb, but it gets boosts from both Life Orb and Sheer Force (total of 69% base power increase).Flamethrower normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. Hyper Cutter prevents the bearer's Attack stat from being lowered by other Pokémon, through moves such as Growl or abilities such as Intimidate.It does not prevent self-inflicted decreases, for example from Superpower.No Pokémon have Hyper Cutter as a hidden ability.
Cloud Nine suppresses all effects brought on by weather, including move power increases, end-of-turn damage, accuracy changes, relevant abilities and so on.
All status problems heal when it switches out.
A Pokémon with Water Absorb heals 1⁄4 of its maximum HP when hit by a Water-type attack.

Sand Veil raises the ability-bearer's evasion by 20% in a sandstorm. It also gives immunity to sandstorm damage (if they are not already protected by being Ground/Rock/Steel type).If a Pokémon with Sand Veil is the leading party Pokémon while travelling in a sandstorm, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.
Raises evasion if the Pokémon is confused.
Prevents the Pokémon from becoming confused.
Makes stat changes have an opposite effect.

Sheer Force increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects.Beneficial effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as:Non-beneficial effects, that Sheer Force will not activate for, include:If the user is holding a Life Orb and uses an attack that activates Sheer Force, it will not receive the 10% damage from Life Orb, but it gets boosts from both Life Orb and Sheer Force (total of 69% base power increase).Flamethrower normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. With Sheer Force, Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn.Note that if a move has an advantageous and disadvantageous side-effect, Sheer Force still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed. For example, Flare Blitz may cause a burn but also has recoil damage. A Pokémon with Sheer Force using the move would gain the power increase and still receive recoil damage, but it would never cause a burn.Here are the moves that increase in power under Sheer Force, listed alphabetically:

Hyper Cutter prevents the bearer's Attack stat from being lowered by other Pokémon, through moves such as Growl or abilities such as Intimidate.It does not prevent self-inflicted decreases, for example from Superpower.No Pokémon have Hyper Cutter as a hidden ability.

Arena Trap prevents opponents from fleeing or switching out. Raised Pokémon are not affected.Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary.If a Pokémon with Arena Trap is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.No Pokémon have Arena Trap as a hidden ability.
Cloud Nine suppresses all effects brought on by weather, including move power increases, end-of-turn damage, accuracy changes, relevant abilities and so on.

Pixilate causes all Normal-type attacking moves used by the Pokémon to become Fairy-type, and increase in power by 20%.Fairy-type Pokémon also gain STAB from those moves (which means an effective increase of 80%).In Generation 6, Pixilate increases affected moves' power by 30%.
All status problems heal when it switches out.

Levitate causes the Pokémon to be raised (like Flying-type Pokémon).Raised Pokémon are not affected by Ground-type moves, Spikes, Toxic Spikes nor Arena Trap. Full details in glossary.No Pokémon have Levitate as a hidden ability.

Levitate causes the Pokémon to be raised (like Flying-type Pokémon).Raised Pokémon are not affected by Ground-type moves, Spikes, Toxic Spikes nor Arena Trap. Full details in glossary.No Pokémon have Levitate as a hidden ability.
Strong Jaw increases the power of all biting moves by 50%.The attacks classed as biting moves are shown below with their normal and boosted power:No Pokémon have Strong Jaw as a hidden ability.
Its Speed stat is gradually boosted.

When a Pokémon with Rough Skin is hit by a move that makes contact, the attacker receives damage equal to 1⁄8 of their maximum HP.Multi-hit moves (e.g. DoubleSlap) activate Rough Skin for each strike.In Generation 3, the damage from Rough Skin is 1⁄16 of the maximum HP.
A Pokémon with Water Absorb heals 1⁄4 of its maximum HP when hit by a Water-type attack.

Sand Veil raises the ability-bearer's evasion by 20% in a sandstorm. It also gives immunity to sandstorm damage (if they are not already protected by being Ground/Rock/Steel type).If a Pokémon with Sand Veil is the leading party Pokémon while travelling in a sandstorm, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.
Prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.If a Pokémon with White Smoke is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.
Shell Armor prevents the Pokémon from receiving a critical hit.

Drought creates harsh sunlight when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition.If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (Drought, Drizzle, Sand Stream or Snow Warning) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon.Prior to Generation 6, Drought lasts indefinitely upon activation.

Thick Fat reduces the damage taken from Fire-type and Ice-type moves by 50%.Interestingly, many Pokémon possessing this ability already take reduced damage from those types. A Dewgong or Walrein with Thick Fat would take 1⁄8 normal damage when hit by an Ice-type move.
Prevents the Pokémon from becoming confused.

A Pokémon with Gluttony will use a pinch berry when its HP drops to 50%, rather than the usual 25%.Pinch berries are: Figy, Wiki, Mago, Aguav, Iapapa, Liechi, Ganlon, Salac, Petaya, Apicot, Lansat, Starf, Micle and Custap. (Their descriptions state that they work in a pinch.)
Prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.

Pressure makes any attack targeted at the ability-bearer - regardless of whether it hits - use 2 PP instead of 1.If a Pokémon with Pressure is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.
Oblivious makes the Pokémon immune to gender-based moves and abilities, specifically Attract, Captivate and Cute Charm.

Solid Rock reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%.For example, a Water-type move used against a Rock-type Pokémon with Solid Rock would deal 1.5× the usual damage instead of 2×. A double weakness would be reduced from 4× to 3×.No Pokémon have Solid Rock as a hidden ability.

Magma Armor prevents the Pokémon from becoming frozen, for example from moves like Blizzard.If a Pokémon with Magma Armor (or Flame Body or Steam Engine) and a Pokémon Egg are amongst the party Pokémon, the number of steps required to hatch the egg are halved.No Pokémon have Magma Armor as a hidden ability.
Anger Point raises the ability-bearer's Attack to its maximum level - +6 stages or 4× usual power - when a move targeting it receives a critical hit.

The Simple ability doubles the number of stages of all stat changes. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.For example, using Swords Dance would increase the Pokémon's attack by 4 stages instead of the usual 2. If Tail Whip was targeted at a Pokémon with Simple, its Defense would drop 2 stages instead of 1.The move Simple Beam can change a Pokémon's ability to Simple.In Generation 4, Simple doubles the effects of stat changes but does not increase the actual number of stages. Stat increases are capped at the same multiplier of ×4, as per the table below. However, the resulting effect is exactly the same as current games.

Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.No Pokémon have Poison Point as a hidden ability.
All status problems heal when it switches out.

Leaf Guard prevents the bearer from succumbing to major status ailments (sleep, burns, poisoning, paralysis or freezing) during sunny weather.It does not prevent minor status ailments such as Confusion or Infatuation, nor does it prevent self-inflicted status conditions such as from using Rest.
Ups Sp. Atk if another Pokémon has Plus or Minus.

Lightning Rod forces all single-target Electric-type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. This includes the status move Thunder Wave. The ability is most useful in double/triple battles.When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.Lightning Rod will activate for an Electric-type Hidden Power, but not Electric-type Judgment.The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the center of attention from the moves Follow Me or Rage Powder.In Generations 3-4, Lightning Rod did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Electric-type attacks. It also did not activate for Hidden Power.In Generations 3-5, this ability's name was formatted as Lightningrod.

Swarm increases the power of Bug-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).If a Pokémon with Swarm is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.

Prankster increases the priority of status moves by +1.This means that a slower Pokémon with Prankster can use a status move before the opponent uses a regular move. Or if the ability-bearer is faster, it could use a status move before the opponent uses a priority move like Aqua Jet.The move Quick Guard does not block moves whose priority is increased by Prankster (but it does block moves that already have increased priority).
Illuminate has no effect in battle.If a Pokémon with Illuminate is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.No Pokémon have Illuminate as a hidden ability.
Its Speed stat is gradually boosted.

When a Pokémon with Rough Skin is hit by a move that makes contact, the attacker receives damage equal to 1⁄8 of their maximum HP.Multi-hit moves (e.g. DoubleSlap) activate Rough Skin for each strike.In Generation 3, the damage from Rough Skin is 1⁄16 of the maximum HP.

Sturdy allows the Pokémon to survive with 1 HP if attacked at full HP with an attack that would otherwise knock it out. It also prevents One-Hit-KO moves (Fissure, Horn Drill, Guillotine or Sheer Cold).If Sturdy activates before the final hit of a multi-hit move (such as Fury Swipes), the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the Pokémon to faint.Sturdy does not prevent self-inflicted KO moves such as Selfdestruct, Explosion and Final Gambit.
Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

Wonder Skin halves the accuracy of all status moves targeted at the ability-bearer.It does not affect self-inflicted status moves like Reflect or Swords Dance, nor does it affect the secondary conditions of attacking moves like Flamethrower.

Normalize causes all moves used by the Pokémon to become Normal-type, and attacking moves increase in power by 20%.Normal-type Pokémon also gain STAB from those moves (which means an effective increase of 80%).The following moves are not affected by Normalize: Hidden Power, Judgment, Multi-Attack, Natural Gift, Revelation Dance, Struggle, Techno Blast, Weather Ball, and damaging Z-Moves.The move Flying Press deals Normal/Flying type damage instead of Fighting/Flying. Freeze-Dry remains super-effective against Water-types, but follows the Normal type chart against other types (e.g. neutral against Grass-types).In Generations 4-6, Normalize did not increase damage (besides any usual boosts like STAB). The Pokémon moves after all other Pokémon do.No Pokémon have Stall as a hidden ability.

Keen Eye prevents the Pokémon from losing accuracy, for example from moves like Sand-Attack.If a Pokémon with Keen Eye is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.
