When a Pokémon with Rattled is hit by a Bug, Ghost or Dark type move, its Speed is raised one stage (up to the usual maximum of +6 stages).

Run Away allows the bearer to flee a battle with a wild Pokémon without fail, even if the opposing Pokémon has used a move like Mean Look or Bind, or has an ability such as Arena Trap.Pokémon with Run Away cannot switch out for another Pokémon, only flee. It does not allow the Pokémon to flee from Trainer battles.

Compound Eyes raises the ability-bearer's accuracy by 30%.In Generations 3-5, this ability's name was formatted as Compoundeyes.If a Pokémon with Compound Eyes is first in the party, Pokémon that can be holding items have that chance increase from 50% to 60% (for common items), 5% to 20% (for uncommon items) or 1% to 5% (for rare items).
Its Speed stat is gradually boosted.
Infiltrator ignores the effects of Reflect, Light Screen and Safeguard. In other words, if the opponent has used Safeguard, Toxic would still badly poison them.

Truant causes the ability-bearer to only attack every alternate turn. On the even turns, it will say the Pokémon is loafing around.If a Pokémon with Truant uses a move that requires recharging on the second turn (such as Hyper Beam), it will recharge on the same turn the Pokémon loafs around. Moves where the user prepares on the first turn and attacks on the second (such as Solarbeam or Fly) cannot be used.The moves Worry Seed, Entrainment and Simple Beam do not work on Pokémon with Truant.Truant can technically be Skill Swapped away, however neither Slakoth, Slaking or Durant learn it.
Soundproof grants the Pokémon immunity to all sound-based moves, preventing all damage and effects.In Generation 5 only, Pokémon with Soundproof could be cured of status conditions by Heal Bell.
Enables moves to hit Ghost-type Pokémon.

Vital Spirit prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep. This means that it also prevents the use of the move Rest.If a Pokémon with Vital Spirit is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

Wonder Guard prevents damage from direct attacks unless they are super-effective. Shedinja is the only Pokémon to have this ability so this means that only Fire, Flying, Rock, Ghost and Dark moves will have an effect.However, Pokémon protected by Wonder Guard are not immune to indirect attacks. Status-category moves still work and all end-of-turn damage will still incur, for example from poisoning, burns, sandstorms or hail. Entry hazards such as Spikes or Stealth Rock will also damage Pokémon with Wonder Guard switching in. Attacks that do not take their type in account will also hit, such as Struggle, Beat Up or Future Sight. Since Shedinja only has 1 HP, any of the above damage will result in an instant knockout.No Pokémon have Wonder Guard as a hidden ability.

Serene Grace doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items King's Rock and Razor Fang from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance).Serene Grace does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio.Shadow Ball normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 40% chance.Air Slash has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item King's Rock is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from King's Rock. This means Serene Grace with Air Slash and King's Rock gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch.In Generations 3-4 Serene Grace does not increase the flinch chance of King's Rock or Razor Fang.In Generations 3-5 Serene Grace does not affect the move Secret Power.

When another Pokémon on the field uses a single-use held item, a Pokémon with Pickup will obtain the used item (if they are not already holding anything) and it can be used again.Pokémon with Pickup will also obtain an item thrown at them with Fling (if they are not already holding anything).In Generations 3-4, Pickup has no effect in battle.When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with Pickup has a 10% chance of picking up an item (if they are not already holding an item).Items picked up range from Potions, Great Balls, Ultra Balls and Rare Candies up to Leftovers and some TMs. Better items have a lower chance of being found; furthermore, higher-level Pokémon will obtain better items.
Honey Gather has no effect in battle.When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with Honey Gather may pick up honey as a held item (if they are not already holding an item).
Makes the foe nervous and unable to eat Berries.

Quick Feet raises the ability-bearer's Speed by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If paralyzed, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Speed.All other effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).If a Pokémon with Quick Feet is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

Guts raises the ability-bearer's Attack by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If burnt, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Attack.All other effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), speed drop (paralysis) or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).

When a Pokémon with Weak Armor is hit by a physical move, its Defense drops one stage, but its Speed increases by one stage.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Magma Armor prevents the Pokémon from becoming frozen, for example from moves like Blizzard.If a Pokémon with Magma Armor (or Flame Body or Steam Engine) and a Pokémon Egg are amongst the party Pokémon, the number of steps required to hatch the egg are halved.No Pokémon have Magma Armor as a hidden ability.

If a Pokémon with Flame Body is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance the attacker will become burned.If a Pokémon with Flame Body (or Magma Armor or Steam Engine) and a Pokémon Egg are both in the party Pokémon, the number of steps required to hatch the egg are halved.

Thick Fat reduces the damage taken from Fire-type and Ice-type moves by 50%.Interestingly, many Pokémon possessing this ability already take reduced damage from those types. A Dewgong or Walrein with Thick Fat would take 1⁄8 normal damage when hit by an Ice-type move.

Snow Cloak raises ability-bearer's evasion by 20% in a hail storm. It also gives immunity to damage by hail (if they are not already protected by being Ice type).If a Pokémon with Snow Cloak is the leading party Pokémon while travelling in a hail storm/blizzard, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.
Oblivious makes the Pokémon immune to gender-based moves and abilities, specifically Attract, Captivate and Cute Charm.

When a Pokémon with Weak Armor is hit by a physical move, its Defense drops one stage, but its Speed increases by one stage.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Magma Armor prevents the Pokémon from becoming frozen, for example from moves like Blizzard.If a Pokémon with Magma Armor (or Flame Body or Steam Engine) and a Pokémon Egg are amongst the party Pokémon, the number of steps required to hatch the egg are halved.No Pokémon have Magma Armor as a hidden ability.

If a Pokémon with Flame Body is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance the attacker will become burned.If a Pokémon with Flame Body (or Magma Armor or Steam Engine) and a Pokémon Egg are both in the party Pokémon, the number of steps required to hatch the egg are halved.

Sturdy allows the Pokémon to survive with 1 HP if attacked at full HP with an attack that would otherwise knock it out. It also prevents One-Hit-KO moves (Fissure, Horn Drill, Guillotine or Sheer Cold).If Sturdy activates before the final hit of a multi-hit move (such as Fury Swipes), the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the Pokémon to faint.Sturdy does not prevent self-inflicted KO moves such as Selfdestruct, Explosion and Final Gambit.

A Pokémon with Gluttony will use a pinch berry when its HP drops to 50%, rather than the usual 25%.Pinch berries are: Figy, Wiki, Mago, Aguav, Iapapa, Liechi, Ganlon, Salac, Petaya, Apicot, Lansat, Starf, Micle and Custap. (Their descriptions state that they work in a pinch.)
Makes stat changes have an opposite effect.

Swarm increases the power of Bug-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).If a Pokémon with Swarm is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.

Skill Link causes multi-strike moves to always hit their maximum number of times. The moves affected are listed below; note that moves such as Double Kick that always strike the same number of times are not affected.In Generation 4, Triple Kick is not affected by Skill Link.
Moxie increases the user's Attack one stage upon fainting an opponent.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Guts raises the ability-bearer's Attack by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If burnt, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Attack.All other effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), speed drop (paralysis) or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).

Technician increases the power of moves - that are usually base power 60 or below - by 50%.Moves with variable base power are boosted only when it is 60 or below. For example, if Magnitude hits at level 6 it will be boosted from 50 to 75, but level 7 will stay at 70 base power.Moves like Sonic Boom that deal fixed HP damage are not affected by Technician.

Swarm increases the power of Bug-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).If a Pokémon with Swarm is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.
Light Metal halves the Pokémon's weight in battle. Decreasing weight affects these moves:
Swift Swim doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during rain.
Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.No Pokémon have Poison Point as a hidden ability.

Intimidate lower's the Attack of all opponents by one stage when the ability-bearer switches in (including the start of a battle).Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.If a Pokémon with Intimidate is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.

Sand Veil raises the ability-bearer's evasion by 20% in a sandstorm. It also gives immunity to sandstorm damage (if they are not already protected by being Ground/Rock/Steel type).If a Pokémon with Sand Veil is the leading party Pokémon while travelling in a sandstorm, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.
Prevents the Pokémon from getting poisoned.

Hyper Cutter prevents the bearer's Attack stat from being lowered by other Pokémon, through moves such as Growl or abilities such as Intimidate.It does not prevent self-inflicted decreases, for example from Superpower.No Pokémon have Hyper Cutter as a hidden ability.
When a Pokémon with Rattled is hit by a Bug, Ghost or Dark type move, its Speed is raised one stage (up to the usual maximum of +6 stages).

Run Away allows the bearer to flee a battle with a wild Pokémon without fail, even if the opposing Pokémon has used a move like Mean Look or Bind, or has an ability such as Arena Trap.Pokémon with Run Away cannot switch out for another Pokémon, only flee. It does not allow the Pokémon to flee from Trainer battles.
When a Pokémon with Rattled is hit by a Bug, Ghost or Dark type move, its Speed is raised one stage (up to the usual maximum of +6 stages).

It also prevents One-Hit-KO moves (Fissure, Horn Drill, Guillotine or Sheer Cold).If Sturdy activates before the final hit of a multi-hit move (such as Fury Swipes), the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the Pokémon to faint.Sturdy does not prevent self-inflicted KO moves such as Selfdestruct, Explosion and Final Gambit.

Sheer Force increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects.Beneficial effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as:Non-beneficial effects, that Sheer Force will not activate for, include:If the user is holding a Life Orb and uses an attack that activates Sheer Force, it will not receive the 10% damage from Life Orb, but it gets boosts from both Life Orb and Sheer Force (total of 69% base power increase).Flamethrower normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. With Sheer Force, Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn.Note that if a move has an advantageous and disadvantageous side-effect, Sheer Force still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed. For example, Flare Blitz may cause a burn but also has recoil damage. A Pokémon with Sheer Force using the move would gain the power increase and still receive recoil damage, but it would never cause a burn.Here are the moves that increase in power under Sheer Force, listed alphabetically:

Sand Force raises the power of Ground, Rock and Steel type moves by 30% during a sandstorm.It also grants immunity to the sandstorm damage, if not already immune (currently this only applies to Shellos since all other Pokémon with the ability are already immune).
Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

Pokémon with the Telepathy ability will not take damage from teammates in double and triple battles.This affects moves such as Surf and Earthquake, which normally hit all Pokémon on the field apart from the user.
Prevents the foe from escaping.

Levitate causes the Pokémon to be raised (like Flying-type Pokémon).Raised Pokémon are not affected by Ground-type moves, Spikes, Toxic Spikes nor Arena Trap. Full details in glossary.No Pokémon have Levitate as a hidden ability.

Levitate causes the Pokémon to be raised (like Flying-type Pokémon).Raised Pokémon are not affected by Ground-type moves, Spikes, Toxic Spikes nor Arena Trap. Full details in glossary.No Pokémon have Levitate as a hidden ability.

Sturdy allows the Pokémon to survive with 1 HP if attacked at full HP with an attack that would otherwise knock it out. It also prevents One-Hit-KO moves (Fissure, Horn Drill, Guillotine or Sheer Cold).If Sturdy activates before the final hit of a multi-hit move (such as Fury Swipes), the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the Pokémon to faint.Sturdy does not prevent self-inflicted KO moves such as Selfdestruct, Explosion and Final Gambit.
Overcoat makes the Pokémon immune to residual damage from weather conditions (specifically Hail and Sandstorm).
Boosts Attack when hit by a Grass-type move.
Inner Focus prevents the Pokémon from flinching, for example when attacked by a move like Headbutt.
The Pokémon awakens quickly from sleep.

Serene Grace doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items King's Rock and Razor Fang from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance).Serene Grace does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio.Shadow Ball normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 40% chance.Air Slash has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item King's Rock is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from King's Rock. This means Serene Grace with Air Slash and King's Rock gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch.In Generations 3-4 Serene Grace does not increase the flinch chance of King's Rock or Razor Fang.In Generations 3-5 Serene Grace does not affect the move Secret Power.

When a Pokémon with Rattled is hit by a Bug, Ghost or Dark type move, its Speed is raised one stage (up to the usual maximum of +6 stages).

Prankster increases the priority of status moves by +1.This means that a slower Pokémon with Prankster can use a status move before the opponent uses a regular move. Or if the ability-bearer is faster, it could use a status move before the opponent uses a priority move like Aqua Jet.The move Quick Guard does not block moves whose priority is increased by Prankster (but it does block moves that already have increased priority).

Insomnia prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep, both from moves by other Pokémon like Sing, and self-inflicted sleep like Rest.If a sleeping Pokémon aquires Insomnia (e.g. from Worry Seed, it will wake up on its next turn.

If the opponent causes a burn, paralysis, or poisoning of a Pokémon with Synchronize, the opponent receives the status condition too. Self-inflicted status conditions (for example through the use of an item) are not passed on.In Generations 3-4, bad poison is only passed on as regular poison.If a Pokémon with Synchronize is the leading party Pokémon, there is a 50% chance of each wild Pokémon encountered having the same nature.No Pokémon have Synchronize as a hidden ability.
Inner Focus prevents the Pokémon from flinching, for example when attacked by a move like Headbutt.
Its Speed stat is gradually boosted.
The Pokémon can check a foe's held item.

With Sheer Force, Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn.Note that if a move has an advantageous and disadvantageous side-effect, Sheer Force still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed. A Pokémon with Stench has a 10% chance of causing the opponent to flinch when hit by a damaging move (provided the ability-bearer strikes first as usual).Stench does not stack with the items King's Rock or Razor Fang, so an ability-bearer holding either item will keep the flinch chance at 10%.In Generations 3-4, Stench has no effect in battle.If a Pokémon with Stench is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.
Neutralizes abilities of all Pokémon in battle.No Pokémon have Neutralizing Gas as a hidden ability.
Misty Surge creates a low-lying mist, like the move Misty Terrain, when the bearer enters battle. It protects all grounded Pokémon from status conditions and halves the power of Dragon type attacks.

Levitate causes the Pokémon to be raised (like Flying-type Pokémon).Raised Pokémon are not affected by Ground-type moves, Spikes, Toxic Spikes nor Arena Trap. Full details in glossary.No Pokémon have Levitate as a hidden ability.

Levitate causes the Pokémon to be raised (like Flying-type Pokémon).Raised Pokémon are not affected by Ground-type moves, Spikes, Toxic Spikes nor Arena Trap. Full details in glossary.No Pokémon have Levitate as a hidden ability.
Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

Reckless increases the power of recoil moves by 20%. By extension, this means the amount of recoil damage taken will increase as more damage is dealt (except for High Jump Kick and Jump Kick which are based on the user's HP).The attacks classed as punching moves are shown below with their normal and boosted power:* No Pokémon with Reckless can learn these moves.

Lightning Rod forces all single-target Electric-type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. This includes the status move Thunder Wave. The ability is most useful in double/triple battles.When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.Lightning Rod will activate for an Electric-type Hidden Power, but not Electric-type Judgment.The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the center of attention from the moves Follow Me or Rage Powder.In Generations 3-4, Lightning Rod did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Electric-type attacks. It also did not activate for Hidden Power.In Generations 3-5, this ability's name was formatted as Lightningrod.

Serene Grace doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items King's Rock and Razor Fang from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance).Serene Grace does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio.Shadow Ball normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 40% chance.Air Slash has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item King's Rock is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from King's Rock. This means Serene Grace with Air Slash and King's Rock gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch.In Generations 3-4 Serene Grace does not increase the flinch chance of King's Rock or Razor Fang.In Generations 3-5 Serene Grace does not affect the move Secret Power.
All status problems heal when it switches out.
May heal an ally's status conditions.
Cloud Nine suppresses all effects brought on by weather, including move power increases, end-of-turn damage, accuracy changes, relevant abilities and so on.
Prevents the Pokémon from becoming confused.
Oblivious makes the Pokémon immune to gender-based moves and abilities, specifically Attract, Captivate and Cute Charm.

Keen Eye prevents the Pokémon from losing accuracy, for example from moves like Sand-Attack.If a Pokémon with Keen Eye is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.

If an attacker faints a Pokémon with Aftermath using a contact move, the attacker will lose 1⁄4 of their maximum HP.

Sheer Force increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects.Beneficial effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as:Non-beneficial effects, that Sheer Force will not activate for, include:If the user is holding a Life Orb and uses an attack that activates Sheer Force, it will not receive the 10% damage from Life Orb, but it gets boosts from both Life Orb and Sheer Force (total of 69% base power increase).Flamethrower normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. With Sheer Force, Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn.Note that if a move has an advantageous and disadvantageous side-effect, Sheer Force still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed. For example, Flare Blitz may cause a burn but also has recoil damage. A Pokémon with Sheer Force using the move would gain the power increase and still receive recoil damage, but it would never cause a burn.Here are the moves that increase in power under Sheer Force, listed alphabetically:

If the opponent causes a burn, paralysis, or poisoning of a Pokémon with Synchronize, the opponent receives the status condition too. Self-inflicted status conditions (for example through the use of an item) are not passed on.In Generations 3-4, bad poison is only passed on as regular poison.If a Pokémon with Synchronize is the leading party Pokémon, there is a 50% chance of each wild Pokémon encountered having the same nature.No Pokémon have Synchronize as a hidden ability.

Magic Guard protects the Pokémon from indirect damage, including:It does not prevent damage from confusion, trapping moves (e.g. Bind) or Struggle.In Generation 4 a Pokémon with Magic Guard cannot be poisoned from Toxic Spikes, nor become fully immobile through paralysis (though the Speed drop still occurs).
Inner Focus prevents the Pokémon from flinching, for example when attacked by a move like Headbutt.
Raises Speed each time the Pokémon flinches.

No Guard ensures that all attacks used by, and targeted at, the ability-bearer hit without fail.This includes moves used on a Pokémon in the hidden stages of the moves Fly, Dive, Dig and Shadow Force.If a Pokémon with No Guard is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.

Guts raises the ability-bearer's Attack by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If burnt, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Attack.All other effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), speed drop (paralysis) or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).

If the opponent causes a burn, paralysis, or poisoning of a Pokémon with Synchronize, the opponent receives the status condition too. Inner Focus prevents the Pokémon from flinching, for example when attacked by a move like Headbutt.

Vital Spirit prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep. This means that it also prevents the use of the move Rest.If a Pokémon with Vital Spirit is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.
Defiant raises the ability-bearer's Attack by two stages when hit by a stat-lowering move.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Anger Point raises the ability-bearer's Attack to its maximum level - +6 stages or 4× usual power - when a move targeting it receives a critical hit.
Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.
Justified raises the ability-bearer's Attack by one stage when hit by a damaging Dark-type move.The Attack rises for every hit of the move Beat Up.Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Intimidate lower's the Attack of all opponents by one stage when the ability-bearer switches in (including the start of a battle).Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.If a Pokémon with Intimidate is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.

When a Pokémon with Flash Fire is hit by a Fire-type move, it does not deal damage but instead raises the power of the bearer's Fire-type moves by 50%. Subsequent hits do not raise the power even more, but the effect remains while the ability-bearer is in battle.
A Pokémon with Water Absorb heals 1⁄4 of its maximum HP when hit by a Water-type attack.
Swift Swim doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during rain.
Damp prevents all Pokémon on the field from using the moves Selfdestruct and Explosion. It also prevents damage (to the Damp Pokémon only) from the ability Aftermath.
Makes the foe nervous and unable to eat Berries.

Technician increases the power of moves - that are usually base power 60 or below - by 50%.Moves with variable base power are boosted only when it is 60 or below. When a Pokémon with Rattled is hit by a Bug, Ghost or Dark type move, its Speed is raised one stage (up to the usual maximum of +6 stages).
The Pokémon is protected from paralysis.

When another Pokémon on the field uses a single-use held item, a Pokémon with Pickup will obtain the used item (if they are not already holding anything) and it can be used again.Pokémon with Pickup will also obtain an item thrown at them with Fling (if they are not already holding anything).In Generations 3-4, Pickup has no effect in battle.When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with Pickup has a 10% chance of picking up an item (if they are not already holding an item).Items picked up range from Potions, Great Balls, Ultra Balls and Rare Candies up to Leftovers and some TMs. Better items have a lower chance of being found; furthermore, higher-level Pokémon will obtain better items.

With Sheer Force, Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn.Note that if a move has an advantageous and disadvantageous side-effect, Sheer Force still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed.
